data.what_is:
Make business personal with a fast, friendly, and convenient business SMS channel for modern support and sales teams. Create stronger customer relationships with two-way communication on the most secure business text messaging platform.

We empower thousands of companies including 1-800-GOT-JUNK?, Tuft & Needle, and Stuart Weitzman to build innovative customer and employee experiences.

Sign up for your free trial at www.textline.com, no credit card required. Questions? Text us at +1 415-849-4349.
data.product_description: Textline is cloud-based software for business text messaging. Textline makes texting a business as easy as texting friends and family.

pricing_plans.plan_description: Three agents included. Messaging cost not included.
Three agents included; $29.99 per additional agent. Messaging cost not included.
Five agents included; $49.99 per additional agent. Messaging cost not included.
plan_features: Priority support with dedicated Customer Success Manager

features.name: Data Import & Export Tools
features.content: Ability to input, modify and extract data from the application in bulk through a structured file.

features.name: Integration APIs
features.content: Application Programming Interface - Specification for how the application communicates with other software.  API's typically enable integration of data, logic, objects, etc with other software applications.

features.name: Breadth of Partner Applications
features.content: To what extent are there partner applications readily available for integrating into this product?  Partner applications typically provide complementary, best of breed functionality not offered natively in this product.

features.name: Customization
features.content: System provides sufficient customization to meet business requirements

features.name: Workflow Capability
features.content: Automates a process that requires a series of steps that typically require intervention by a several different users.  Administrators can write rules to determine who and when a user needs to complete a step.  Also includes notification of users when they need to take action.

features.name: User, Role, and Access Management
features.content: Grant access to select data, features, objects, etc. based on the users, user role, groups, etc.

features.name: Internationalization
features.content: Enables users to view and transact business with the same content in multiple languages and currencies.

features.name: Sandbox / Test Environments
features.content: Allows administrators to easily develop and test changes to the CRM deployment.  After changes are made admins can easily migrate the changes into the "live" or "production" environment.

features.name: Performance and Reliability
features.content: Software is consistently available (uptime) and allows users to complete tasks quickly because they are not waiting for the software to respond to an action they took.

features.name: Output Document Generation
features.content: Allows adminstrators to create templates that enable users to quickly generate dynamic documents in various formats based on the data stored in the application.

features.name: Optimization
features.content: Optimizes marketing campaigns for mobile devices.

features.name: Integrations - Mobile Marketing
features.content: Integrates advertising/campaigns into mobile applications, games, and mobile browsers.

features.name: Internationalization
features.content: Facilitates global text message and mobile marketing campaigns.

features.name: User Authorization - HIPAA Compliant Messaging
features.content: Allows administrators to set up and implement any levels of authorization required to send and receive secure messages

features.name: Compliant Texting - HIPAA Compliant Messaging
features.content: Facilitates the receiving and sending of secure and encrypted text messages

features.name: Compliant Emailing - HIPAA Compliant Messaging
features.content: Facilitates the receiving and sending of secure and encrypted emails

features.name: Clinical Communication - HIPAA Compliance
features.content: Facilitates communication between health care professionals

features.name: HIPAA Compliance - HIPAA Compliant Messaging
features.content: Aligns and complies with HIPAA regulation and standards

features.name: Operating Systems - HIPAA Compliant Messaging
features.content: Supports desktop, iOS, and Android operating systems

features.name: Message Lifespan - HIPAA Compliant Messaging
features.content: Allows the determination and assignment of the lifespan of a delivered message

features.name: Workflow Enhancement - HIPAA Compliant Messaging
features.content: Enhances clinical workflows

features.name: Building and Personalizing Emails
features.content: Create and design emails with an editor; manage templates; personalize dynamically

features.name: Sending Outbound Emails
features.content: Create targeted lists, schedule and manage bulk email sending.

features.name: Manage Email Deliverability
features.content: Ensure inbox delivery. Includes opt-in management, bounce handling, unsubscribe processing, suppression lists, email preview, spam checking, link validation, and delivery monitoring.

features.name: Automated Email Responses
features.content: Set up automated nurturing emails based on events, online activities, and lead scores

features.name: Landing Pages and Forms
features.content: Build customized landing pages and lead capture forms for specific marketing campaigns to maximize conversion and to capture the right qualifying information.

features.name: Dynamic Content
features.content: Dynamically customize emails, forms, and landing pages for specific segments of customers and prospects.

features.name: A/B Testing
features.content: Test alternate versions of emails, landing pages, and forms. Learn what works, maximize response rates, and increase conversion.

features.name: Mobile Optimized
features.content: Support mobile-optimized emails, online forms, and landing pages.

features.name: Search Tracking and Optimization
features.content: Track performance of keywords and links in major search engines.  Measure search rankings and performance.  Improve page-level SEO with tools to diagnose and improve page performance.  Integrate with Google AdWords.

features.name: Marketing Lead Database
features.content: A marketing lead database is the system of record for your most important marketing asset: your leads and contacts. Includes a view of all marketing interactions between each prospect and your company, including website visits, email clicks, scoring changes, and data updates/history.

features.name: Data Quality Management
features.content: Data quality consists of deduplication, cleansing, and appending your marketing database.

features.name: Segmentation
features.content: Segment your database and build list of target leads and contacts.  Filter on demographic and company attributes (title, company size, location) as well as behavioral filters and CRM information.

features.name: Lead Scoring and Grading
features.content: Automatically qualify and score leads based on demographics as well as prospect online behaviors, including recency and frequency. Assign your own weights to determine lead scores for prioritization.

features.name: Lead Nurturing
features.content: Automate drip marketing campaigns that send relevant messages over time, based on prospect behaviors and pre-defined campaign steps.

features.name: Online Behavior Tracking
features.content: Track which emails a prospect opens and clicks, what web-pages they visit, what keywords they use, even what they say on social networks.

features.name: Automated Alerts and Tasks
features.content: Create tasks automatically and provide real-time sales alerts over email, RSS or mobile device.

features.name: CRM Lead Integration
features.content: Sync lead, contact, account, and opportunity information with your CRM system.

features.name: Program ManagementView full feature definition
features.content: Manage marketing campaigns and programs across multiple channels, including online ads, video campaigns, mobile, virtual events, and social media. Create and optimize program assets such as landing pages, emails, campaigns, and lists. Track program objectives, results, and costs to assess the program ROI.

features.name: Event / Webinar Marketing
features.content: Streamline the entire event process, including personalized invitations, registration, reminders, and post-event follow-up.  Integrate with online meeting tools like WebEx, Adobe Connect, GoToWebinar.

features.name: Calendaring
features.content: Maintain a marketing calendar across multiple groups. Manage the calendar for the entire marketing department, from promotions to content to PR.

features.name: Budgeting
features.content: Manage all aspects of marketing investments, including assigning top-down budgets to various groups and divisions, planning marketing spending across programs, tracking open-to-spend, ensuring budget compliance, coordinating work-flows and permissions, and reconciling plans with actual invoices.

features.name: Social Listening
features.content: Monitor what leads and contacts say on sites such as Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, LinkedIn, blogs, and online communities.  Incorporate into your lead and customer DB and use social insights to segment prospects.  Trigger campaigns, and update lead scores.

features.name: Social Sharing

features.name: Social Campaigns

features.name: Basic Reporting

initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textline?
There are many reasons why we continue to use Textline for our business! The amount of ease of reaching customers without hassle or confusion is amazing. Our customers are able to communicate with us outside of business hours and we can receive it the next business day. When the internet is down, we can access Textline from our personal phones so we are always able to communicate with our customers. We use Textline daily! Customer support is always knowledgable and quick to respond and resolve any issues!

What do you dislike about Textline?
The main thing that I dislike about Textline is that it charges per each user, instead of it being included in the monthly plan. However, it's definitely worth it! It is definitely cost efficient. The other providers that claim to offer free services, end up forcing you into paying them after you have established history with them, and they end up being more expensive than Textline.

What problems is Textline solving and how is that benefiting you?
Being able to reach out to our customers from our computer is really helpful in our business. Often times, customers are unable to speak on the telephone, so being able to text them is extremely convenient for them! It also looks more professional for us when a customer walks in, to see us on the computer typing rather than a cellphone in our hands.

initial_reviews.review_title: I am a Support Line Operator. Our organization provides support to those that call or text.
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textline?
Textline is very straight forward and user friendly. Texts updates in real time allowing us to interact with those that need support and allows the conversation to flow with no lag. Since it is not a bot you are texting back and forth between 2 real people making it a more organic experience then if it was pre-programmed.

What do you dislike about Textline?
I find only one annoyance with Textline and it's probably more helpful than a hinderance. I often don't have enough characters to finish a text. Due to the sensitive nature and complexity of support we offer, I find thatt when addressing certain issues or if the texter is very active I run out of room. MHowever, it is helpful so the user doesn't send a huge overwhelming text to someone. I am definitely more pro for the amount of characters since I am more
mindful while texting and staying on point so l can't ramble on.

What problems is Textline solving and how is that benefiting you?
Textline allows those that prefer texting or whom feel hesitant about calling can get the same support. This benefits everyone and allows us to communicate with a larger audience. Many people these days prefer texting over calling. I know I do!

initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textline?
It's very helpful to have multiple users answering texts together. It helps us tackle a large daily volume, but also allows staff members to step in and assist or correct s needed. It also keeps a long history if there is ever a need for us to look back at an earlier conversation for our records. The announcements and automations are also a helpful feature. It is quite easy to use and learn. I love the whisper feature and short cut responses as well.

What do you dislike about Textline?
Lately textline has had a few bugs that have interrupted our services and ability to respond. On the rare occations we have needed help and text in, they have always solved our problem which is great - they are also always friendly and helpful - but is often much slower than a usual "text for help" services and can take many hours to go back and forth which is tricky when staff members need to leave for the day.

What problems is Textline solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have a large customer base that often need quick answers to questions, and textline allows us to help a larger volume than if we had people just manning the phones.

initial_reviews.review_title: Textline is very helpful in my line of work
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textline?
Our office utilizes textline for communication with the clientele that we serve. I like Textline because it allows easy access to a business line and allows for necessary separation of work and personal. My supervisors are able to also monitor my line easily from their devices as needed so that they can step in to assist with communication when I am not available. Textline is easy to use and it's easy to forget that you're using an application sometimes. It feels like natural messaging.

What do you dislike about Textline?
Sometimes textline provides error messages that are unclear when a message is being sent. I have been able to navigate some of these issues by rewording a message that gets flagged; however, it's not always clear what the issue is with a given message.

What problems is Textline solving and how is that benefiting you?
Textline is allowing staff in this agency to communicate with clientele without concern of losing chat history and without overlooking important messages. Due to the feature of messages being routed to a different individual within the company every 15 minutes, every conversation gets addresssed in a timely manner.

initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textline?
In todays society, texting seems to be the most effective. Not everyone checks their emails, and notifications can go into spam or just get lost in the shuffle. With everyones hectic schedule, sometimes you want to get a message across quickly and effectively. Texting has an amazing open rate since it goes direct to the source. Besides it's ease of use and integration, Textline is great for instant communication to your contacts. We use it frequently, daily actually, and it's played a valuable roll in our business. The customer support is also amazing as it's great to contact a live agent should we have any questions. We are very happy on our implementation of Textline!

What do you dislike about Textline?
Honestly I don't have anything negative to say about it.  We did have a slight issue not being able to text certian numbers due to a carrier restriction, however when contacting customer support, they helped us to understand the issue and find a solution.

initial_reviews.review_title: Textline helps us easily communicate with our dance families
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textline?
I love the tag feature! This allows us to put our dance families into groups and then we can easily send texts to specific groups of people. For example, if we have a closure on a Monday we can text only our Monday families with the details. We also use the announcement feature often to send texts to large groups of people. The announcement feature is very easy to use and consistently delivers our messages. We use Textline daily in our business to communicate with individual families as well. Our families find it very convenient to text versus call or email with updates such as absences or basic questions. Textline is user-friendly - my staff can easily navigate the platform.

What do you dislike about Textline?
Honestly, the only downside for us has been the required details provided regarding privacy policies, scripts to customers, etc. I believe this is at least somewhat out of Textline's control though as new laws/regulations have been instated.

What problems is Textline solving and how is that benefiting you?
Textline makes it convenient for us to reach our families and it also makes it convenient for our families and leads to reach us. We've found that the majority of our customers prefer the ease of texting over email or phone calls.

initial_reviews.review_title: A lot of steps in the name of security
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textline?
Textline integrates fully with Zendesk and am able to send and receive messages from within a Zendesk ticket.

What do you dislike about Textline?
1.  setting up new agents is now very inconvenient. We use international agents and the initial verifcaton process is very difficult as half the agents do not receive repsonses due to carrier blocks.

2. We had some phishing hack that caused us to have to change the number for a department, which meant we had to recreate a new department to replace it.  This resulted in tickets not being created in Zendesk and it took a week of back and forth with support for them to realize it needed authorized internally, which should have been apparent the moment we described the issue.

What problems is Textline solving and how is that benefiting you?
Allows us to provide support and notifications for our cusotmers.

initial_reviews.review_title: Excellent customer service, could use additional features
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textline?
The customer service is helpful and quite responsive. I really appreciate the tenacity with which they dig into solving any issues that may come up. The user guides are some of the most useful I've seen with any software, and make it easy for anyone to get up and running with Textline.

I love how easy it is to integrate with other programs through Zapier - it's definitely leveled up our customer service by being able to send text confirmations of meetings and other activities.

What do you dislike about Textline?
I do wish there was a first and last name field instead of just "name," as it would be great to be able to include personalization in some of our messages. I also wish that there was a way to see when contacts were updated & by who as we've had some challenges with this in the past that could be resolved with training, but I don't know who on the team needs the training.

What problems is Textline solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use it to communicate frequently with our clients, many of whom are high school students. Textline makes it easy to make sure that all questions are being addressed, alert team members when they need to jump in, and show the conversation history with each contact. We also use it (through Zapier) to send meeting confirmations and reminders and it's been really helpful to cut down on the number of missed meetings.

initial_reviews.review_content:

Very user-friendly system for sending mass texts, automated texts via their API, and was easy to implement. Customer Support is quick with their Textline HQ chat. We use textline every day and integrate it accross many systems.

What do you dislike about Textline?
Some of their built-in automation tools caused us some issues during implementation but we were able to find work-arounds and they were receptive to our feedback. Plus their API does not return error responses when messages fail this is an issue I heard from another user when looking up reviews. We had to create a custom script to guess the failures and retry them but this isnt a barrier to use and I would still recommend them.

What problems is Textline solving and how is that benefiting you?
Getting quick messages out to people.

All of our employees and customer communications are tied together seamlessly so that as team mates we can pick up where one another have left off without any inconvenience to the customer.

What do you dislike about Textline?
The inability to do group messaging can sometimes be a nuisance.

What problems is Textline solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our customer service representatives can only speak on the phone to one person at a time which creates a bottleneck.  On Textline, they can simultaneously help several customers at once. Also, there is a written record between us and the customer which can also be useful in our business.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textline?
There are many reasons why we continue to use Textline for our business! The amount of ease of reaching customers without hassle or confusion is amazing. Our customers are able to communicate with us outside of business hours and we can receive it the next business day. When the internet is down, we can access Textline from our personal phones so we are always able to communicate with our customers. We use Textline daily! Customer support is always knowledgable and quick to respond and resolve any issues!

What do you dislike about Textline?
The main thing that I dislike about Textline is that it charges per each user, instead of it being included in the monthly plan. However, it's definitely worth it! It is definitely cost efficient. The other providers that claim to offer free services, end up forcing you into paying them after you have established history with them, and they end up being more expensive than Textline.

What problems is Textline solving and how is that benefiting you?
Being able to reach out to our customers from our computer is really helpful in our business. Often times, customers are unable to speak on the telephone, so being able to text them is extremely convenient for them! It also looks more professional for us when a customer walks in, to see us on the computer typing rather than a cellphone in our hands.

all_reviews.review_title: I am a Support Line Operator. Our organization provides support to those that call or text.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textline?
Textline is very straight forward and user friendly. Texts updates in real time allowing us to interact with those that need support and allows the conversation to flow with no lag. Since it is not a bot you are texting back and forth between 2 real people making it a more organic experience then if it was pre-programmed.

What do you dislike about Textline?
I find only one annoyance with Textline and it's probably more helpful than a hinderance. I often don't have enough characters to finish a text. Due to the sensitive nature and complexity of support we offer, I find thatt when addressing certain issues or if the texter is very active I run out of room. MHowever, it is helpful so the user doesn't send a huge overwhelming text to someone. I am definitely more pro for the amount of characters since I am more
mindful while texting and staying on point so l can't ramble on.

What problems is Textline solving and how is that benefiting you?
Textline allows those that prefer texting or whom feel hesitant about calling can get the same support. This benefits everyone and allows us to communicate with a larger audience. Many people these days prefer texting over calling. I know I do!

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textline?
It's very helpful to have multiple users answering texts together. It helps us tackle a large daily volume, but also allows staff members to step in and assist or correct s needed. It also keeps a long history if there is ever a need for us to look back at an earlier conversation for our records. The announcements and automations are also a helpful feature. It is quite easy to use and learn. I love the whisper feature and short cut responses as well.

What do you dislike about Textline?
Lately textline has had a few bugs that have interrupted our services and ability to respond. On the rare occations we have needed help and text in, they have always solved our problem which is great - they are also always friendly and helpful - but is often much slower than a usual "text for help" services and can take many hours to go back and forth which is tricky when staff members need to leave for the day.

What problems is Textline solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have a large customer base that often need quick answers to questions, and textline allows us to help a larger volume than if we had people just manning the phones.

all_reviews.review_title: Textline is very helpful in my line of work
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textline?
Our office utilizes textline for communication with the clientele that we serve. I like Textline because it allows easy access to a business line and allows for necessary separation of work and personal. My supervisors are able to also monitor my line easily from their devices as needed so that they can step in to assist with communication when I am not available. Textline is easy to use and it's easy to forget that you're using an application sometimes. It feels like natural messaging.

What do you dislike about Textline?
Sometimes textline provides error messages that are unclear when a message is being sent. I have been able to navigate some of these issues by rewording a message that gets flagged; however, it's not always clear what the issue is with a given message.

What problems is Textline solving and how is that benefiting you?
Textline is allowing staff in this agency to communicate with clientele without concern of losing chat history and without overlooking important messages. Due to the feature of messages being routed to a different individual within the company every 15 minutes, every conversation gets addresssed in a timely manner.

all_reviews.review_content:

In todays society, texting seems to be the most effective. Not everyone checks their emails, and notifications can go into spam or just get lost in the shuffle. With everyones hectic schedule, sometimes you want to get a message across quickly and effectively. Texting has an amazing open rate since it goes direct to the source. Besides it's ease of use and integration, Textline is great for instant communication to your contacts. We use it frequently, daily actually, and it's played a valuable roll in our business. The customer support is also amazing as it's great to contact a live agent should we have any questions. We are very happy on our implementation of Textline!

What do you dislike about Textline?
Honestly I don't have anything negative to say about it.  We did have a slight issue not being able to text certian numbers due to a carrier restriction, however when contacting customer support, they helped us to understand the issue and find a solution.

all_reviews.review_title: Textline helps us easily communicate with our dance families
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textline?
I love the tag feature! This allows us to put our dance families into groups and then we can easily send texts to specific groups of people. For example, if we have a closure on a Monday we can text only our Monday families with the details. We also use the announcement feature often to send texts to large groups of people. The announcement feature is very easy to use and consistently delivers our messages. We use Textline daily in our business to communicate with individual families as well. Our families find it very convenient to text versus call or email with updates such as absences or basic questions. Textline is user-friendly - my staff can easily navigate the platform.

What do you dislike about Textline?
Honestly, the only downside for us has been the required details provided regarding privacy policies, scripts to customers, etc. I believe this is at least somewhat out of Textline's control though as new laws/regulations have been instated.

What problems is Textline solving and how is that benefiting you?
Textline makes it convenient for us to reach our families and it also makes it convenient for our families and leads to reach us. We've found that the majority of our customers prefer the ease of texting over email or phone calls.

all_reviews.review_title: A lot of steps in the name of security
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textline?
Textline integrates fully with Zendesk and am able to send and receive messages from within a Zendesk ticket.

What do you dislike about Textline?
1.  setting up new agents is now very inconvenient. We use international agents and the initial verifcaton process is very difficult as half the agents do not receive repsonses due to carrier blocks.

2. We had some phishing hack that caused us to have to change the number for a department, which meant we had to recreate a new department to replace it.  This resulted in tickets not being created in Zendesk and it took a week of back and forth with support for them to realize it needed authorized internally, which should have been apparent the moment we described the issue.

What problems is Textline solving and how is that benefiting you?
Allows us to provide support and notifications for our cusotmers.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent customer service, could use additional features
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textline?
The customer service is helpful and quite responsive. I really appreciate the tenacity with which they dig into solving any issues that may come up. The user guides are some of the most useful I've seen with any software, and make it easy for anyone to get up and running with Textline.

I love how easy it is to integrate with other programs through Zapier - it's definitely leveled up our customer service by being able to send text confirmations of meetings and other activities.

What do you dislike about Textline?
I do wish there was a first and last name field instead of just "name," as it would be great to be able to include personalization in some of our messages. I also wish that there was a way to see when contacts were updated & by who as we've had some challenges with this in the past that could be resolved with training, but I don't know who on the team needs the training.

What problems is Textline solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use it to communicate frequently with our clients, many of whom are high school students. Textline makes it easy to make sure that all questions are being addressed, alert team members when they need to jump in, and show the conversation history with each contact. We also use it (through Zapier) to send meeting confirmations and reminders and it's been really helpful to cut down on the number of missed meetings.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textline?
Scheduled messages make reminding customers about their prescription refill date approaching makes life so much easier than using a Google calendar reminder and having to print something out. We also use the automated responses afterhours to help educate our customers on how we do business. Also, we use the shortcuts dozens of times an hour to alert customers to their orders being ready, to share tracking details, and to inform them of when to expect further texts or phone calls.

What do you dislike about Textline?
The only thing we haven't quite figured out is how to use the search function. Also, when you're composing a message to one customer, and another message comes in and you click on that message, it leaves the message you're typing in that other conversation, so sometimes we end up sending messages meant for one customer to another because it doesn't keep text written but not sent in the thread you were composing it in if that makes sense.

Recommendations to others considering Textline:
It's secure, it's relatively intuitive to figure out, and the more you use it, the more you realize the functionality you aren't using might end up being something you use.

What problems is Textline solving and how is that benefiting you?
Over half of our time on the phone is spent sitting on hold with doctors' offices, so while we wait on hold, we can keep working. We're one of the only compounding pharmacies in our area, and since several other compounders have closed up, and usually, without alerting their customers before permanently closing, we wouldn't be able to get any work done because all we would do would be answering the phone. Textline allows us to keep communicating even if we can't speak in person. It's also great for ensuring the people who need callbacks are available for our call. We hate voicemails!

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Textline?
The UX is so easy to learn and manage; I can oversee a team as well as collaborate with colleagues all within the interface; notifications are easy to set up and make sure I don't miss anything; the app is wonderful for on-the-go!

What do you dislike about Textline?
I love the autoresponders, but wish there was a trigger to turn certain ones off if we are responding ourselves (for instance, we have an autoresponder outside of our work hours, but if someone happens to be available and engages the customer, they still ALSO get our autoresponder every time they answer us, telling them we're out of office, these are ours hours, etc.).

Recommendations to others considering Textline:
Look at all of the possible integrations! Zapier and HelpScout integrations were key for us.

What problems is Textline solving and how is that benefiting you?
As a business centered on community, any opportunity to open an additional line of communication with each of our individual members is amazing. With thousands of members, not everyone works best via certain lines of communication - Textline opens us up to another avenue that may best suit some of our customers who weren't as engaged before (asking us questions, getting the most out of their membership).
